body:
> So… if someone updates to this new version of RSV but happens not to have the latest installation of CA data, we are happy saying that they are screwed?

@osg-cat, are you saying the rsv changes here rely on data installed from the latest CA certs packages?

While the new `osg-ca-certs` package does lay down a `/etc/grid-security/certificates/cacerts_sha256sum.txt` file, my read is that this rsv probe verifies based on the contents of http://repo.grid.iu.edu/pacman/cadist/cacerts_sha256sum-new.txt (link broken as it is currently only available from [repo-itb](http://repo-itb.grid.iu.edu/pacman/cadist/cacerts_sha256sum-new.txt)).

In any case, I tried downgrading the `osg-ca-certs` package to the previous version (without the sha256 checksums), and running this new version of the probe still succeeds.  It does give a `WARNING` for the out-of-sync CA `UKeScienceCA-2B`, but that is independent from the sha256 changes...
